meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bright.
meanings.sent1: The brightnesses of the stars lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the soft brightnesses of the morning sun.
meanings.sent3: The brightnesses of the fireflies made the garden look like a magical place.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a brightnesses that could light up a room.
meanings.sent5: The brightnesses of the rainbow were a beautiful sight after the storm.

meanings.definition: The amount of light emitted or reflected by an object.
meanings.sent1: The brightnesses of the flashlight helped us find our way in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The brightnesses of the lamp filled the room with a warm glow.
meanings.sent3: The brightnesses of the firefly jar made it look like a tiny lantern.
meanings.sent4: The brightnesses of the full moon illuminated the path through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The brightnesses of the city at night were a sight to behold from the hilltop.

meanings.sent1: The brightnesses of the red paint made the room feel vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The brightnesses of the blue sky contrasted with the white clouds.
meanings.sent3: The brightnesses of the green grass seemed to sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The brightnesses of the yellow flowers brightened up the garden.
meanings.sent5: The brightnesses of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
